messages.message:
I'm getting this error when starting up control-plane in my sandbox (https://instabase.sandboxes.site/sandboxes/neerad?cw=dev):
```Host OS is linux
echo "/* This file is auto-generated. Do not modify by hand. */" > /home/owner/instabase/core-services/control-plane/src/go/src/instabase/controlplane/frontend/src/constants/version.ts
nodenv: version `22.14.0' is not installed (set by /home/owner/instabase/core-services/control-plane/.node-version)
echo "export const COMMIT_ID = '79075d1c24';" >> /home/owner/instabase/core-services/control-plane/src/go/src/instabase/controlplane/frontend/src/constants/version.ts
echo "export const RELEASE_VERSION = '25.22.0';" >> /home/owner/instabase/core-services/control-plane/src/go/src/instabase/controlplane/frontend/src/constants/version.ts
yarn --cwd /home/owner/instabase/core-services/control-plane/src/go/src/instabase/controlplane/frontend install
nodenv: version `22.14.0' is not installed (set by /home/owner/instabase/core-services/control-plane/.node-version)
nodenv: version `22.14.0' is not installed (set by /home/owner/instabase/core-services/control-plane/.node-version)
make: *** [Makefile:85: build-frontend] Error 1```
which seems to be related to the 22.14.0 upgrade. Am I missing something?
If you’ve resynced your sandbox can you connect to it and run `nodenv install 22.14.0`

After doing that, I get
```yarn --cwd /home/owner/instabase/core-services/control-plane/src/go/src/instabase/controlplane/frontend install
nodenv: yarn: command not found

The `yarn' command exists in these Node versions:
  18.16.1```
Earlier today, I tried to resolve this by just installing yarn for 22, but didn't work. Let me try that again.
Hmm try to cd into the control plane directory so you’re using node 22 and run `npm install -g yarn`
ok that and `npm install -g @bazel/bazelisk` seems to have done the trick
